title: Engineering Manager, Software Development, Identity Solutions
description:
We are seeking an engineering leader to help build and lead a diverse team of engineers to design, develop, and deliver Spunk’s Identity solutions. Splunk’s Identity solutions allows customers to connect their own identity and access management solution to Splunk or use Splunk’s built in solution. This technology space within Splunk is used by every customer during every interaction with the product and maintains a high security and operational bar in order to protect our customers. The ideal candidate is an experienced leader able to work with product management, other engineering leaders, and their team to envision and execute on world class Identity solutions. Collaboration and partnerships are paramount in our company culture and we want leaders who can communicate at a high level but also talk in low level details to achieve the greater goal.**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Recruit, mentor, and grow world class engineers.
* Partner with cross functional team members to develop and maintain a well defined roadmap, while balancing technological excellence.
* Lead technical direction and architecture with engineering team members.
* Facilitate coordination of a scrum team to successfully deliver committed feature sets.
* Drive practices in training and development, and drive efficiencies across multiple feature teams.
* Build a culture of continuous learning, growth, and sharing of technological insights.

**Requirements:**
-----------------

* 8+ years of hands-on technical experience.
* 2+ years of direct management experience of highly technical engineers.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or another quantitative field. We will consider equivalent practical experience.
* Experience in delivering multiple complex technical projects within an Agile environment.
* Experience with Identity and Identity standards (SAML, OAuth, OIDC, LDAP, SCIM, Etc)

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**
-------------------------------------

* Proficiency with backend systems built using microservices, monolithic architecture, containerized infrastructure, and waterfall and agile delivery practices.
* Demonstrated ability to build a culture of team building and people management.
* Entrepreneurial drive and ability to reach stretch goals in a fast-paced environment.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

**What We Offer You:**
----------------------

* A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We’re always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
* A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.
* Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
* A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Fun. It is one of our core tenets.
* Work life balance, with efficient work from home environments today and modern offices standing by for future times.

  

Note:

**Base Pay Range**


SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area


Base Pay Range: $163,200.00 - 224,400.00 per year


California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts


Base Pay Range: $148,000.00 - 203,500.00 per year


All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area.


Base Pay Range: $136,800.00 - 188,100.00 per year


Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. Please note that the base pay range is a guideline and for candidates who receive an offer, the base pay will vary based on factors such as work location as set out above, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. **In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for incentive compensation and may be eligible for equity or long-term cash awards.**


Benefits are an important part of Splunk's Total Rewards package. This role is eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off and much more! Learn more about our comprehensive benefits and wellbeing offering at https://splunkbenefits.com.

title: Project Manager
description:
**\\*\\*Project Manager\\*\\***  

**This position is remote (work from home) eligible.**  

**Salary: $80,000 - $130,000 depending on experience.**  

  

**Join Our dynamic team at Celerity Consulting Group!**  

At Celerity, we help companies resolve their litigation, risk, compliance, business, and project challenges. Our name, “Celerity,” embodies swiftness, and that’s precisely how we operate. Day-to-day life here is dynamic, and we thrive on responding swiftly to changes as they unfold.  

  

**Why Celerity?*** We hire bright minds and empower them with the tools and infrastructure needed to excel.

**About the Job**  

The Project Manager is responsible for planning and executing projects. This work will require collaborating with a cross-functional team spanning multiple departments and contractors.  

  

**Duties include:*** Primary ownership of multiple projects.
* Manage projects according to Project Management Professional (PMP) principles, as applicable.
* Manage projects according to client policies and procedures.
* Coordinate with client stakeholders and contractors.
* Attend client project meetings and field site visits.
* Provide status reports per client requirements.
* Apprise clients of issues which may impact scope, schedule, or budget.
* Manage additional scope through the change order process.
* Regularly seek client feedback.
* Gain proficiency in the use of client software needed for project delivery.
* Ensure accurate and timely invoicing.
* May be required to work extended hours during special projects.

**The person who will thrive in this role will be:*** Adaptable
	+ Flexible when circumstances change that affect scope and schedule.
* A Good Communicator
	+ Communicates in a straightforward and tactful manner. Able to write in a clear and concise style.
* Curious and a Continuous Learner
	+ Eager to learn about processes and how to use the tools and systems essential for project completion.
* A Problem Solver
	+ When an issue arises, able to determine who to involve in resolving the issue and how to determine what factors affect viable solutions.
* A Team Player
	+ Can switch between leading and following as the work requires. A dependable person who gets things done.

**Minimum Qualifications*** Bachelor’s degree
* Driver’s license and ability to drive to field locations as needed

**Preferred Qualifications*** 2+ years of experience in project management.
* Project Management Professional Certification

**Physical Demands:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Constantly operate a computer and other office productivity equipment, such as a mouse, keyboard, scanner, copier, and a calculator.
* Occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at a time.

*The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.*  

  

We are proud to offer a comprehensive health and welfare benefit package that includes:  

  

**HEALTH & WELL-BEING*** Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance

**PEACE OF MIND*** 401(k) plan + matching
* Flexible Spending Account
* Health Savings Account
* Disability Insurance (STD/LTD)
* Basic Life/AD&D

**WORK/LIFE BALANCE*** Hybrid/Flexible Work Schedules
* Paid Time Off
* Company Holidays
* Leave of Absence

**ADDITIONAL PERKS*** Charitable Contribution Match
* Employee Referral Program
* Professional Development


Celerity is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veterans’ status or other status protected by applicable law.  

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

title: Technical Lead I
description:
The Framework Builder FE team is currently developing a sophisticated platform tool that is aimed at streamlining the management of framework metadata. Our tools are used by hundreds of our developers, with the primary goal of increasing efficiency in our internal development process. Our primary front-end tech stack includes JavaScript, Typescript, React, and Redux. We are looking for a talented front-end focused Tech Lead who is motivated to work on high-visibility projects and has the technical acumen to tackle challenging problems.



As a technical lead on the Framework Builder team at HubSpot, you'll do many things— and you likely already have experience doing some of them in the past. We are looking for people who:


* Have previous software engineering experience in a senior or tech lead position - managing engineers and taking responsibility for the team's software design and delivery, while making individual contributions to the codebase.
* Can identify a problem, build a case for it, and execute independently, leaning into ambiguity
* Foster an environment that encourages autonomy and psychological safety.
* Never accept the status quo; we need engineers and leaders who can see beyond what we have, and towards what we can build while maintaining an understanding about how to get there.
* Demonstrate pragmatic decision-making and problem-solving abilities.
* Work autonomously, lead transparently, and prioritize product and people over strict processes.
* Partner with their triad (Product Manager and Product Designer) to design, scope, and deliver solutions to help our customers manage and grow their businesses.


Tech Leads play to their strengths but are aligned with HubSpot's mission and show the leadership qualities that we've found to be most effective.


*Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as the 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.*

  


**Cash compensation range:** 173500-225600 USD Annually  

  

This resource will help guide how we recommend thinking about the range you see. Learn more about HubSpot's compensation philosophy from Katie Burke, HubSpot's Chief People Officer.
  

  

The cash compensation above includes base salary, on-target commission for employees in eligible roles, and annual bonus targets under HubSpot's bonus plan for eligible roles. In addition to cash compensation, all HubSpotters are eligible to participate in HubSpot's equity plan to receive restricted stock units (RSUs). Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay. Individual compensation packages are based on a few different factors unique to each candidate, including their skills, experience, qualifications and other job-related reasons.
  

  

We know that benefits are also an important piece of your total compensation package. To learn more about what's included in total compensation, check out some of the benefits and perks HubSpot offers to help employees grow better.
  

  

At HubSpot, fair compensation practices isn't just about checking off the box for legal compliance. It's about living out our value of transparency with our employees, candidates, and community.  

  

  



*We know the**confidence gap* *and* *imposter syndrome* *can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply — we'd love to hear from you.*

  


**If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us** **using this form****.** *This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.*

  


***Germany Applicants:*** *(m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page* *here**.*

  



**About HubSpot**



HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.



You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.



Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.



*By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's* *Privacy Notice* *explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.*

title: Program Manager (Pharmaceutical)
description:
*Think Company operates in the United States as a fully remote company. As such, please consider this a remote (work from home) position. Please note that Thinkers are expected to operate within Eastern Standard Time Zone business hours.*

 **FLSA Status: Exempt**  

**Type:** Full-time  

**Annual Base Salary:** $100,000 - $130,000

  

Think Company is looking for a **Program Manager** who is a proactive problem solver, skilled relationship builder, and agile multi-tasker with Commercial Pharmaceutical promotion experience . Launch experience is a plus. In this role, you will be the hub of our team within our client’s organization —overseeing and managing a program of initiatives within a pharmaceutical organization. This program is focused on Non-personal promotion tactics targeting HCPs.


Critical to your success will be your ability to organize and prioritize efforts, identify dependencies and risks, and facilitate the removal of blockers to work progress. Communication is an essential part of this role - to your stakeholders, vendors, and client partners. This communication will keep everyone who is part of the program aligned, aware, and will eliminate surprises. At times you will be the voice of the program, representing the department you work for in meetings or presentations.

**Responsibilities of a Program Manager**

* Help shape the emerging roadmap, organize, and oversee progress on each sub-initiative
* Report on program measurement and health in a clear and concise manner tailored to your audience
* Align efforts across multiple teams and workstreams to deliver on the organization's goals and strategy
* Unblock and support day-to-day operations, including other vendors and partner organizations
* Schedule and host regular meetings to gather and communicate status, plan changes, risks, and issues
* Manage concise definition of scope across the entire program
* Provide insight by actively seeking out information from product teams, vendors, and executive stakeholders
* Create and maintain documentation relevant to the management of the program and associated projects
* Map out and define the list of dependent projects that need to be completed to reach the overall goal
* Develop and manage workflows to meet outcomes for multi-month, multi-track engagements, knowing how to prioritize and segment work, and how to focus the team on what matters most
* Anticipate and properly communicate resource needs to maximize impact
* Create strong relationships and encourage team behaviors that foster deep collaboration and partnership
* Ensure overall program and business goals are achievable

**Qualifications include, but are not limited to**

* Minimum 6+ years of experience managing programs and large-scale projects
* 4+ years of experience in a Senior client-facing role at a consultancy or similar client services environment
* Ability to create executive-level presentations and reports. Must be able to expertly manage and report on program health, budget, and resources
* Keen insight into human behavior and motivational forces to assist in managing various types of people
* Proficient in a wide range of project and program management processes and methodologies
* Proven track record of managing diverse projects and teams effectively achieving project goals and deadlines
* Proven ability to react positively and recover from problematic situations
* Strong business acumen with an understanding of implementing measurable processes
* Excellent oral and written communication skills for effective communication to clients, internal staff, and executive management. Ability to interface with high-level client executives (up to C-level)
* Experience in leading teams launching and maintaining websites, portals, or other software is a plus
* Ability to translate business strategy into tactics
* Capable of managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
* Proficient in identifying and leading ceremonies, workshops, and/or processes to obtain data necessary to lead at a strategic program level
* Demonstrate versatility, conviction, and a commitment to outstanding client service

**Preferred**

* Pharma commercial promotion and launch experience
* Experience with process mapping, establishing governance practices, change management

**Who we are**


Think Company defines and solves business problems for companies across a wide range of industries, from start-ups to Fortune 50 organizations. Our environment is dynamic and highly matrixed, involving design, development, and project management. We do more than production—we conduct discovery, research, ideation, prototyping, testing, and implementation.


Our employees—Thinkers—present concepts to executive-level stakeholders, answer hard questions, and use evidence to make recommendations. Our solutions often solve the challenges of modern companies—integrating multiple systems, breaking down organizational silos, and creating more holistic service experiences. See examples of our typical projects.


We are a design firm that encourages fun, creativity, and relationship building. Check out Think Company's Core Values.


Think Company is dedicated to greater diversity and inclusion within our organization and provides equal opportunity to people of all races, ethnicities, religions, genders, sexual orientations, gender identifications, abilities, income, marital status, ages, philosophies, disabilities, and veteran status.


Recruiters and staffing companies **need not** contact us and **do not** have permission to contact people on our behalf.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager


Bloom, the insurance industry’s trusted growth partner, is looking for an experienced and dedicated Product Manager to be responsible for designing, planning, launching, and monitoring assigned products and/or product features. The Product Manager will be responsible for growing the product capabilities and utilization within the assigned product(s) user base(s). The right candidate will understand how to meet the needs of clients, influence strategic growth, and work with clients, prospects, and internal teams to deliver the product objectives. The right candidate will be excited about a fast-paced environment and have an extraordinary ability to take initiative and navigate unchartered paths.


**We are looking for an exceptional leader who can:**


* Create or assist in the creation of product strategy and business requirement for new features or products.
* Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams.
* Responsible for product vision and continuous improvement of assigned features and/or products.
* Participates in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including analysis, design, testing, and integration of products as well as the introduction of products to the market.
* Lead and obtain strategic buy-in from internal and external stakeholders as necessary.
* Communicate product vision, roadmap, progress, and other key messages and engage with many diverse functional stakeholders through the product lifecycle.
* Actively seek customer and market input and data as a source of product innovation
* Act as the SME during initial roll-out and provide support when needed after product/feature launch.
* Responsible for continuous improvement of product post-commercialization
* Prioritize product features and requirements backlogs compromising both the business needs and technical readiness. Ability to participate in technical discussions and help make design trade-offs.
* Identify both business and technical impediments, assist in solving both and remain a primary steward for product advancement.
* Create documentation and communications to set expectations for delivery of new features/products.
* Guide direction for user stories related to assigned features/products to ensure precise development team execution.
* Work closely with functional business owners and client liaisons to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value and priority.
* Liaise, manage, and negotiate with IT SaaS vendors on all product-related issues as needed.
* Engage and support our Finance team in the creation of finance modeling/pricing associated with assigned products/features.
* Support our Business Development team by ensuring that documentation and education have been provided in order that they can effectively sell assigned features/products.
* Support the sale process as needed to deepen business partnerships in collaboration with the Business Development team to expand current client portfolio and/or create new business.
* Support our Product Operations team in defining KPIs, building analytics dashboards, internal and external reporting, and other tools to measure the impact of our solutions.
* Research your assigned product/feature(s) markets and audience to ensure that you remain in constant understanding of what our market and audience need and how to recommend positioning our product accordingly.
* May participate in the creation of documentation or user guides for new products/features.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.
* Participate in conferences and networking events as schedule permits.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.


**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, health care administration or a related field
* 5+ years of experience in product development and/or product management required.
* Experience in a professional health insurance service role preferred.
* Experience with government programs healthcare enrollment strongly preferred.
* Medicare sales department knowledge a plus
* Expertise in the product or market including specific technical or industry knowledge.

**Skills and Abilities**

* Excellent written and oral communication skills are required; this role must have the ability to communicate with team members, other departments, upper management, and consumers of the company’s products.
* Superior project management and interpersonal skills
* Ability to maintain a keen attention to detail, multitask and work well under pressure and manage tight deadlines.
* Ability to work independently or collaboratively with a team in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Strong accountability and continuous initiator
* Entrepreneurial spirit highly skilled in innovative thinking and ability to drive solutions.
* Natural tendency to be curious, positive, and creative.
* Sincere empathy for the customer and a commitment to delving deep into the challenges they present or experience.
* Proficiency using MS Office programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)
* Understanding of quality customer service
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle/process
* Demonstrated consistent patience, respect, and professionalism.
* Highly organized
* Ability to interpret and communicate complex data or concepts and relay concerns clearly and concisely.
* Demonstrated ability to advocate for the needs of the business and customer with proven results.

**Travel Requirements**


* Up to 10% of the time

### **What We Offer**


At Bloom, we offer an engaging, supportive work environment, great benefits, and the opportunity to build the career you always wanted. Benefits of working for Bloom include:


* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive health benefits
* Long-term career growth and mentoring


### **About Bloom**


Bloom is a third-party insurance services provider that partners with Medicare health plans to enable high-quality Medicare enrollment and drive earlier health plan activation. Founded in 2007, Bloom has partnered with national and regional payers to implement solutions for every step of the member journey, from telesales and quote & enroll to health activation outreach. Supported by its Ascend technology platform, Bloom produces closer connections and better outcomes for Medicare beneficiaries and health plan stakeholders to deliver High Value Enrollment.


### **Ascend Platform**


Bloom provides advanced enrollment and health activation solutions to the insurance industry through the Ascend platform. Our Ascend platform supports insurance shopping, new member enrollment, and extended engagement that lead to better outcomes for Medicare health plans, brokers, agents, and beneficiaries.


**Bloom is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer.** We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

title: Service Desk Analyst
description:
Remote
Information Technology – Service Desk /
Full-Time /
Remote

The vision of Clinical Health Network for Transformation (CHN) is to better fulfill the mission and promise of Planned Parenthood to bring high-quality, affordable care to every member of our communities. CHN is a collaboration between **Planned Parenthood affiliates across the United States.**  

CHN is looking for individuals who are committed to supporting our shared goal of strengthening and **enhancing our awareness and commitment to advancing the cause of health and race equity** in our organization.  

The Service Desk Analyst will be an integral member of our services team that will provideonsite support across multiple-member locations. The role will be responsible for the **full lifecycle of process and procedure management**, ticket and service support, and escalation management. This role will have high visibility and impact as you will play a key role in how our staff experience technology at CHN. The position will be engaged in activities related to the technical support, design, and delivery of end user computing technologies, automation, and scripting/coding. The individual will be self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision and a passion to learn new technologies and be willing to experiment. If applicable, this position will entail 60% travel to cover its respective service area.  

  

**Looking for a candidate with experience and interest in leading the full lifecycle of service process and procedures, including authoring and creating new process and procedures.**### **Essential Functions**


Lead the full lifecycle ownership of processes, procedures, and standards as assigned
Champion and adhere to processes, procedures, security, and architectural standards
Provide Tier 2-3 support, on escalated incidents from our helpdesk related to our workstation and mobile environments, including support for hardware, operating systems, drivers, and applications
Assist with software deployments, application packaging, scripting, operating systems deployments, computer imaging, and security for end user computing devices
Serve as the point of contact to the affiliate operations leader for respective service area; re-directing service issues through the existing service model. Triaging escalated tickets to the appropriate members of the service team
Develop and maintain login scripts, utility scripts, and other tools using PowerShell, VBS, and other relevant programming languages
Assist with the development of roadmaps, documentation, and takes ownership for various end user computing solutions (hardware, operating systems, Microsoft Office, SCCM, Microsoft Intune, Vulnerability / patch management, VDI, etc.)
Manage and maintain positive working relationships with vendors and customers
Manage remote hands resources dispatched to your service area
Assist with capacity planning and yearly budgeting
Assist with projects from idea generation to implementation, including selection, recommendation, design, testing, and implementation of various solutions
Compatibility and QA testing of applications, operating systems, and application packages
Administration of end user computing solutions, including SCCM, Intune, and various technologies
As needed participation in after-hours maintenance windows to update, change, and install various systems.
Produce, maintain and update technical documentation related the end user computing environment
Ensures compliance with all CHN and affiliate policies, as well as all state and federal regulations
Demonstrates a commitment to CHN and Planned Parenthood’s mission related to health equity, especially centering racial equity, and deep sense of accountability to community
Demonstrates a commitment to learning about and enhancing practices related to racial equity and the impact of structural racism on healthcare systems
Provides positive and development feedback and accountability related to practices including, but not limited to, equity+ ***The above duties and responsibilities are not an exhaustive list of required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, and this job description can be amended at any time.***
### **Qualifications (Required)**


Associate’s degree in Computer Science (or related field), or comparable experience
Excellent customer service skills
Demonstrated ability to maintain a customer-centric service approach in a fast-paced environment
Microsoft Windows 10 and Microsoft Office support and troubleshooting experience
Experience troubleshooting hardware, software, and driver issues
Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) experience
Vulnerability and patch management systems
Application packaging experience (i.e. Flexera AdminStudio, InstallShield, etc.)
PowerShell, automation, and scripting skills
Mobile Device Management (MDM), including Microsoft Intune
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Proficiency with Microsoft software (Excel, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to collaborate and interact with all levels within and outside of CHN if necessary
Strong attention to detail and follow-up; and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrated dedication to Planned Parenthood’s mission, vision, and values
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders, including end users, vendor dispatched remote hands, and IT coworkers
Excellent time management, and problem-solving skills
If applicable, willingness to travel in accordance with the needs of the position, as outlined in the essential functions. Compliance with all CHN travel policies, including safety guidelines while operating a personal vehicle### **Qualifications (Preferred)**


Bachelor’s degree
Experience working in high pressure situations and adhering to strict timelines
Ability to collaborate with teams made up of internal and external stakeholders### **Key Requirements**


Commitment to advancing race and equity in one’s work: interested in expanding knowledge about the role that racial inequity plays in our society
Awareness of multiple group identities and their dynamics, bringing a high level of self-awareness about personal identity, empathy, and humility to interpersonal interactions
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and directly as well as hear and act on feedback related to identity and equity with the aim to learn
Strong sense of accountability to equitable practices
Understanding of the impact of identity dynamics on organizational culture
Commitment to CHN and Planned Parenthood’s In This Together service ethos, workplace values, and service standards**Total Rewards.** CHN provides employees with a competitive compensation and benefits; some highlights include the following.* Above Position Compensation Range: $52,000 annualized (Minimum); goes up based on relevant experience
* Geographic Differentials available for residences of NYC (Manhattan & Boroughs)
* Health Care Coverage (Medical, Dental, & Vision); eligibility for full-time, regular employees on date of hire
* Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Savings Account
* Short-Term Disability and Basic Life & AD&D Insurance provided by CHN
* Voluntary elections for Long Term Disability and Additional Life & AD&D Insurance available at cost
* Employee Assistance Program
* Retirement Plan, 3% employer match after one year of service
* Paid Time Off Program includes accrual-based PTO and nine (9) paid Holidays

  

Clinical Health Network for Transformation (CHN) is an equal employment opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender and gender expression/identity, age, ethnicity, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, uniformed service member/veteran status, marital status, medical condition, pregnancy, sexual orientation, citizenship status, genetic information, as well as any other category protected by federal, state, or local. **We are committed to building an inclusive workplace that values racial & social justice. We strongly encourage all persons to apply, including people of color and members of the LGBTQ community.**

title: Software Project Manager
description:
**Software Project Manager**
============================

Wärtsilä Energy Storage & Optimization (ES&O) is the leading global energy storage optimizer. Our mission is to deliver integrated energy solutions that build a resilient, intelligent, and flexible energy infrastructure - unlocking the way to an optimized renewable future. By integrating renewables, energy management technology, and storage with traditional energy resources, we reinvent clean energy production from the largest and most complex grids to the most remote and essential microgrids. We play a key role in Wärtsilä’s vision towards a 100% renewable energy future through flexibility, reliability, and integration and a more sustainable world for us all.

  


The primary function of this role is to accelerate the development of our software products by holistically organizing, tracking, and prioritizing team efforts. The role will be an integral part of the Software Engineering teams in a Research and Development roles, supporting new product development initiatives in the field of Energy Storage & Optimization.

  

The preferred location for this position is Herndon, Virginia. This position will be a hybrid work structure where the employee can work remotely or from the office, as needed and based on demands of specific tasks. Another location that will be considered for this position is Houston, Texas.

  


**Essential Responsibilities**  

* Meet regularly with stakeholders for backlog grooming and prioritization of upcoming efforts.

* Capture the vision of what we are building and then accelerate the realization of that vision by keeping the priorities organized.
* Manage the interdependence between new feature development and Software Engineering group’s software release schedules, ensuring successful execution of our product roadmap.
* Develop and maintain the roadmaps, tracking progress and reporting regularly.
* Work with technical experts to develop project scopes and objectives to ensure technical feasibility.
* Ensure resource availability and allocation.


* Perform risk management notifying stakeholders of expected results as soon as possible.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation.


* The candidate must be able to embrace the fast and dynamic environment of a growth stage company, comfortable with adjusting quickly to changing priorities.

  


**Qualifications/Requirements**  

* Demonstrated software project management experience and accomplishment with commercial software product companies.
* Embedded software experience is preferred
* Solid technical background in software development
* Agile methodology and proficient in issue tracking tools such as Atlassian tools.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and skills
* Excellent organizational and people skills

* Attention to detail in the context of managing multiple software projects simultaneously.
* Previous hands-on coding experience

  


 **Desired Characteristics**  

* Experienced working in STEM context.
* Prior experience with production systems running advanced statistical algorithms and machine learning.
* Strong leadership record with active participation in renewable energy associations, forums, clubs, or groups
  


Last application date: 18/03/2024

  


**Why you and us:**


You will be a part of a global organization with local presence and work in an exciting and dynamic working environment with highly motivated and skilled co-workers. We offer interesting and challenging work tasks, as well as personal and professional development in a great team. If you feel excited by being a part of this working environment and think your personal skills and qualities match the job requirements, we look forward to receiving your job application. At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities.

  


**Successful applicant must be authorized to work in the USA without sponsorship**. We look forward to hearing from you. Qualified candidates must apply online: https://www.wartsila.com/careers

  


Individuals hired for positions that require on-site customer interactions and/or in-person travel may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or other country-specific vaccinations, unless otherwise prohibited by law. Wärtsilä North America values our employees. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. Wärtsilä North America is an EOE/AA employer.

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**About this role**



We are seeking a talented and highly motivated individual to join our Product Management team as a Technical Product Manager. In this role, you'll integrate deeply with our Enterprise Data & Development Teams to lead the development and implementation of enterprise-level communication, data, and reporting products.
  

  

This role will be pivotal in leveraging technologies such as Snowflake and Tableau Cloud to deliver scalable, robust, and efficient solutions to our clients so that they can extend the capabilities of our data offering on their own. In addition, the candidate will have the opportunity to leverage data from a multi-sided platform model to drive new features on the Enterprise level. Our product team serves as the bridge between the business and technology teams, and we thrive on innovation, conceptualization, design, and piloting new capabilities to solve real customer problems. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise, product management skills, and customer-facing capabilities.


**Apply if you're excited to:**


* Serve as a trusted advisor for stakeholders, driving key business outcomes with real impact on the company roadmap
* Engage with diverse teams and clients to align Petvisor solutions with real industry problems–overseeing, managing, and developing our data-driven software product
* Integrate closely with data and development teams for technical planning and deployment
* Manage Agile operations for efficient cross-departmental collaboration
* Develop clear documentation and processes for product understanding and adoption for internal and external audiences
* Illustrate business problems and value proposition to technical and executive audiences at all levels of our organization
* Conduct feedback sessions with customers for pre-development input, then bring that feedback back to an engaged development team eager to solve problems in new ways
* Validate product use cases and feasibility through demos with internal SMEs, users, and secondary audiences
* Support Strategic Account Managers with day-to-day product and technical needs–serving as the product evangelist to facilitate inquiries and provide technical support for customers as they adopt new features
* Collaborate on veterinary industry solutions to enhance data product value
* Stay updated on competitive technologies for strategic positioning


**About You**


* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Research, or related fields, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, Solutions Architect, or Data Contributor
* Internal and/or external consulting or customer-facing experience
* Exemplary written and verbal communication skills coupled with unparalleled follow-up skills
* Understanding of data analytics stack and workflow, including ETL, data platform design, BI, and analytics tools
* SQL experience required; high-level understanding of data warehousing, cloud data architecture, and data modeling beneficial


**Benefits & Perks**  

PetDesk is a remote organization, focused on a culture, infrastructure, and ecosystem that supports team members' participation in critical decisions and information sharing, regardless of location. Benefits and perks include:


* Medical coverage for employees and dependents (80-90% covered by employer)
* Employer HSA contribution with HDHP
* 401(k) match up to 3.5%
* Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Dental & Vision coverage available
* Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability
* Flexible Time Off & 13 Paid Annual Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave
* Pawternity Leave, Financial Pet Adoption Support & Subsidized Pet Insurance
* $250 Annual Stipend for Learning and Development


**Pay Range**


$134,000—$150,000 USD
Petvisor is the parent company of a family of brands that includes PetDesk, Vetstoria, WhiskerCloud, Kontak, and Groomer.io. Petvisor equips veterinary practices and pet services businesses with a suite of mobile-enabled tools, facilitating better communication, service, and client retention. The company's innovative approach supports over 10,000 veterinary clinics, 400 grooming facilities, and over 20 million pet parents globally.



We are an equal opportunity and strive for a culture where everyone feels empowered to celebrate their whole, authentic selves at work. We encourage varied approaches and points of view to cultivate an inclusive workplace where difference is valued. Diversity fuels innovation and strengthens our bond with our customers and the communities we serve.


Our recruiting process is rooted in "Who: The A Method of Hiring" and consists of an average 2-week hiring timeline. This standardized interview process allows candidates to answer the same questions, experience the same process, and ensure a fair performance review from multiple perspectives.



Please, no external recruiters—candidate profiles submitted from external recruiting agencies will not be considered.


**Notice at Collection to Applicants Residing in California**  

Depending on your location, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate how we manage job applicants' data. Our full notice outlining how your data will be processed as part of the application procedure for application locations is available at this link. By submitting your application, you agree to our use and processing of your data as required.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**Who we are**


Braid Health is a digital health innovation company focused on the development and delivery of an AI-powered diagnostic collaboration platform for radiology and the healthcare industry.


Imagine a world in which everyone can access the best medical expertise regardless of where they live, how much money they have, or what they know. We believe access to medical expertise should be universal.


We’re generalists and truth seekers with a ton of experience (Apple Design, Twitter AI). We’re already helping people now and have an opportunity (and responsibility) to help millions or even billions more!

**Job Overview:**


We are looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager who will be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects within scope, budget, and schedule. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent project management skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. In addition, this role will have a significant client-facing aspect, requiring the ability to build strong relationships and ensure client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle.

**Re****sponsibilities:**

* Cultivate strong relationships with clients and key stakeholders. Understand client needs, expectations, and priorities. Serve as the primary point of contact for client communication.
* Collaborate with clients to define project goals and requirements. Work closely with the client to develop project plans, ensuring alignment with their business objectives. Provide consultation on technical solutions and best practices.
* Work closely with the technical support team to maintain a global understanding of Braid’s different accounts’ technical difficulties and identify product gaps.
* Partner with implementation managers to understand account particularities, establish delivery timelines, and ensure successful rollout through effective project management methodologies.
* Be your account’s advocate during internal Braid discussions, ensuring project alignment with client expectations and technical feasibility.
* Generate progress reports for clients and senior leaders within the organization, including detailed project status updates, risk assessments, and mitigation strategies.
* Maintain clear and consistent communication with both internal and external stakeholders. Provide regular project updates to clients, address concerns, and ensure transparency in project progress.
* Facilitate client training sessions on new technologies or solutions. Ensure a smooth onboarding process for clients, addressing any technical or procedural questions.
* Conduct thorough requirements gathering sessions with clients to understand their specific needs. Translate client requirements into actionable project plans and deliverables.
* Monitor client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle. Proactively address any issues or concerns raised by clients to ensure a positive and successful partnership.
* Conduct product demonstrations and presentations for clients. Showcase project progress and new features, gathering feedback and ensuring alignment with client expectations.
* Effectively manage and escalate client concerns or issues to the appropriate internal teams. Ensure timely resolution and client satisfaction.

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years of Account and or Project Management experience supporting SAAS, medical, dental, or B2B software.
* 3+ years of experience navigating the clinic environment (primary care, urgent care, dental office).
* 3+ years of experience as a strategic partner for healthcare accounts.
* Strong experience in technical project management, including planning, scheduling, and executing complex software implementation projects.
* Ability to juggle multiple competing tasks and demands with the appropriate sense of urgency, applying project management principles and tools.
* Confidence to work independently, take initiative, and complete tasks with a high degree of accountability for project outcomes.
* Demonstrated problem-solving skills by gathering information and using judgment that is consistent with the company’s standards, best practices, and policies.
* Experience with Google Suite, Salesforce (or similar CRM), Notion, Slack, and project management software (e.g., Linear, Microsoft Project, Asana, or Jira) is an asset.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical project statuses to non-technical stakeholders.
* Must reside within the US or Canada

**What We Offer**

* Excellent Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits (PPO Plan)
* Fully Remote Work Environment in CA, TX, NJ, GA, IA, MD, OR, FL, NV, TN, SC, WA, IL, CO, MA, DC
* An opportunity to significantly improve healthcare around the world
* Work with cutting edge technology (Machine Learning) in novel ways, not yet fully mapped to industries
* Collaboration with Veteran founding team, with a successful track record across the globe
* Competitive annual compensation in the range of $70,000-$90,000 USD


If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for driving successful projects and building strong client relationships in the healthcare technology space, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Braid Health.

  





OztiCl40GM

title: Project Specialist, DMC (Remote)
description:
### **Description and Requirements**

**ABOUT WCG**: WCG’s clinical solutions are built on a foundation of best-in-class clinical services companies. We deliver transformational solutions that stimulate growth, foster compliance, and maximize efficiency for those performing clinical trials. WCG is proud to serve individuals on the frontlines of science and medicine, and the organizations striving to develop new products and therapies to improve the quality of human health. It is our role to empower them to accelerate advancement, while ensuring the risks of progress never outweigh the value of human life.

 **WHY WE LOVE WCG**: At WCG, our employees are our most valuable asset, and as with all our assets, we invest in them with an eye toward future success. We provide each eligible employee with a comprehensive set of benefits designed to protect their personal and financial health to help make the most of their future.

* Comprehensive Benefits package - Health, Dental, Vision, Life Disability, 401k with match, and flexible spending accounts
* Employee Assistance Programs and additional work/life resources
* Referral Bonuses and Tuition Reimbursement
* Flexible PTO
* Volunteer Time Off to benefit the community
* Opportunities for career development with on-the-job training, certification assistance, and continuing education reimbursement

Expected annual base salary range: $51,500 to $72,000


GPS level: P1

**JOB SUMMARY:** The Project Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day administration and organization of client projects (working closely with the Project Managers) to ensure that projects and their assigned deliverables are produced on time, within budget and according to the agreed upon scope of work.

  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES** **:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required.

* Drafting, editing, and distributing reports to clients and DMCs.
* Noticing and reporting to statistical leads inconsistencies between data tables/figures and report text.
* Ensuring quality control of documents and reports.
* Editing reports to assure consistency between presentations and text.
* Organizing confidential study materials and maintaining project logs.
* Documenting study correspondence.
* Preparing table, figure, and listing shells for Statistical Analysis Plans.
* Under the supervision of the PM, coordinating conference calls and meetings with clients and DMCs.
* Communicating with DMC members and clients with PM review.
* Drafting minutes of internal and external meetings.
* Assisting with QA or administrative projects as needed.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor. These may, on occasion, be unrelated to the position described here.

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:** Associate’s Degree or 1 to 2 years of related administrative experience; or the equivalent combination of education, skills and experience to perform the job.


**QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Exposure to project management team environment desired. Must have at least six (6) months of demonstrated administrative experience supporting projects or programs.
* Critical thinking and analytical skills required.
* Knowledge of financial management a plus.
* Knowledge of project management software tools and management techniques a plus.
* Excellent problem solving/decision making skills.
* Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
* Excellent organizational and planning skills with the ability to utilize technology and tools.
* Excellent interpersonal skills.
* Strong facilitation and coordination skills.
* Ability to function effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Attention to detail skills required. Must take pride in work product results; strive towards 100% accuracy in work processes.
* Knowledge of MS Office, specifically Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:**


* 0% – 5%

  

* 5% - 10%

  

* 10% - 20%

  

* 20% - 50%

  

* >50%


  

**Physical and Sensory Requirements****:** The physical and sensory requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be offered to individuals with disabilities to assist in performing the essential functions of the position. Work activities involve light to moderate physical effort (for example, sitting in one place for extended periods of time, standing, walking, bending, lifting lightweight objects, intermittent to sustained periods of keyboarding). Majority of time is spent in a seated position with frequent opportunity to move about at will. Activities require a variety of easy muscle movements. Work activities involve a frequent need to concentrate on a variety of sensory inputs for moderate to lengthy durations at a time requiring diligence and attention to interpret effectively. There will be a need to attend to single or simultaneous tasks where accuracy of details is important. The need for detailed and precise work is high.

  

**WCG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer** – Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin or ancestry, religion or creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran status, reprisal or any other legally recognized basis or status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Learning Technology Manager
description:
**What You'll Do**
==================

  

As a Learning Technology Manager, you will lead the learning technology team and be responsible for leading, managing, and mentoring teams of learning technologists. You will use your strong technical and leadership skills to drive operational excellence for learning technology design and development at iDesign.  

  

Successful candidates must thrive in a fast-changing environment, be adaptive, and be a continuous learner in the technology realm. They will significantly impact our web portals and participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle.


*This is a fully remote, full-time, W-2 position.*


**You will:**
-------------


**Drive Operational Excellence in Learning Technology Development:**


* Oversee and continuously refine the learning technology course build process, ensuring excellence across all operational program developments
* Oversee leads who are running the LMS template developments, accessibility, discovery and innovation, interactive e-learning, and other learning technology talent areas
* Drive efficiencies in the learning technology course build process, ensuring consistent quality across all program developments
* Leverage data analytics to assess time-to-development, streamline costs, and introduce innovative solutions
* Stay updated on industry best practices, integrating new strategies that enhance the team's expertise without burdening financial resources


**Lead and Develop Learning Technology Teams:**


* Lead the team to success through strong management principles
* Foster an environment that prioritizes our company's mission, vision, and values
* Prioritize and delegate tasks, aiming to cultivate a team of independent leads who can spearhead developments autonomously
* Provide structured feedback and coaching, facilitating the growth of each team member
* Regularly evaluate individual and team performance, recognizing achievements, and addressing any gaps in an actionable manner
* Collaborate with Directors, integrated service leads, and VPs


**Manage Learning Technology Talent:**


* Oversee hiring processes, ensuring we attract and onboard top-tier talent
* Manage both full-time and contracted learning technologists
* Develop comprehensive onboarding materials and processes to seamlessly integrate new hires and contractors
* Strategically staff projects, accommodating the evolving needs of large and complex projects
* Ensure that every project is adequately staffed with skilled professionals who are set up for success
* Leverage data analytics and collaborate with staffing support personnel to ensure talent matching and adequate staffing for all real-time learning technology operations and program builds
* Lead regular training sessions, ensuring the team remains updated and skilled in current methodologies


**Make Collaborative, Strategic Decisions in Learning Technologies:**


* Act as a bridge between the team and the leadership, conveying company-wide priorities
* Promote LX and UX principles in learning technology design and development
* Promote ways of building and make decisions that optimize learning outcomes
* Facilitate goal-setting exercises for leads and specialists that align with overarching company objectives
* Periodically seek feedback from team members on leadership effectiveness and areas for improvement


**What You Need to Get the Job Done**
=====================================


* Bachelor's Degree in a related field or equivalent combination of experience
* Proven experience in online learning technology design, development, and leadership
* Proficiency in learning technology team leadership, talent development, and operational efficiency
* Proven experience in learning management systems and core LX and UI/UX principles in learning technology development
* A keen understanding of learning technology processes and the ability to drive innovations in this area
* Experience with hiring, onboarding, and managing staff for large and dynamic projects
* Strong analytical skills, with an ability to derive actionable insights from data in order to drive efficiencies and innovation
* A collaborative mindset, with a focus on fostering inclusivity and open communication


**What Will Make Us REALLY Love You**
=====================================


* Desire to learn, adapt, and evaluate new technologies, skills, and approaches for implementing solutions
* Proven ability to be a self-starter and move the needle from the brainstorming phase to actuality
* Ability to communicate and work well with technical team members and other non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrate excellent oral/written communication skills
* Possess a great work ethic and are effective working both independently and collaboratively on projects
* Exceptionally organized and display effective time-management skills for meeting tight deadlines in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
* History of excelling in projects that require a strong ability to navigate ambiguity
* Comfort with both managing contract and non-contract workforces
* Demonstrate the ability to solve complex problems using a high degree of independent judgment


**What You'll Love About Us**
=============================


**Great Company Culture**. We like to have fun while we work hard. iDesign has a collaborative, congenial workplace where everyone counts.


**Meaningful Work.** All iDesigners make a big impact and are expected to make their work count. What we do impacts students' lives!


**Rest and Relaxation.** Flexible paid time off and 12 paid holidays.


**Health Benefits.** Medical, dental, and vision, and life insurance. Medical plan has several extra participant program benefits.


**Prepare for the Future.** 401(k) with a generous company match.


**Work that Stays at Work.** Genuine work/life balance served here!


**Working Remotely.** You can work in whatever quiet place you find that has a secure, solid broadband connection and a place to set up your laptop.


*iDesign is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an inclusive environment in which everyone is a valued member. At iDesign, all hiring decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. We seek applicants of diverse backgrounds and hire without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Manager, Product Management (Remote Opportunity)
description:
**You Belong at Greenway**



Bring your best and truest self. We celebrate what makes us different and what brings us all together. At Greenway Health, we are committed to an inclusive environment and a culture of belonging as we pursue our purpose of healthier communities, successful providers, and empowered patients. We are united in our goal to build the future of healthcare technology. Join us.



Greenway Health seeks a Manager, Product Management responsible for shaping and executing on the vision for Interoperability services, including FHIR, SMART-on-FHIR applications, and other Interoperability solutions/services across the Greenway product ecosystem. Reporting to the Director, Product Management, this leader will develop and evangelize the overall product vision and strategy to drive growth and align with overall company/board objectives.



As Manager, Product Management, this role will use data-driven insights, knowledge of strategy, and structured problem-solving skills to bring about transformational change in Greenway’s products and the value they provide to our clients. In addition, this role will partner across functional stakeholders to align the product strategy to efficiently deliver market-leading solutions on schedule with the highest quality.


**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**


* Develop and evangelize overall technical shared services vision and strategy to drive growth and market dominance across the Greenway product ecosystem
* Ensure high contact within the Product Management function to the existing clientbase ensuring the roadmap aligns to upcoming market conditions, the solutions being built take into account clients’ diverse workflow needs and that the solutions already in the hands of clients operate to allow their success
* Facilitate all functions within Greenway to act in the role of a trusted advisor to our clients
* Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the market forces and addressable opportunities, both short- and long-term
* Directly manage, coach and mentor Product Management resources
* Establish strong partnerships with functional leads across the company to execute end-to-end from product vision to go-to-market launch
* Instill strong product team culture by encouraging a bias for action, communication, innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement
* Contribute to product management processes with a 360-degree focus on areas including clients, competitors, industry, sales, PSO, support, hosting, etc.
* Work with Product Development teams to deliver on roadmap items which (i) drive growth/clients based on what clients are willing to pay for, (ii) what enables the ability to maximize existing client retention, and (iii) what enables the company to operate with successful business margins, and (iv) ensures the delivery of compliant regulatory information
* Organize and optimize the team structure to enable operational best practices, to align with new product focus, and to prepare for team growth.
* Clearly communicate to fellow Greenway co-workers the market need, the expected outcomes of the defined user flows and help R&D teams by being an arbiration point between alternative solutions to balance cost versus benefit versus schedule


**Experience and Education**


* BA/BS Degree preferably in Business Management, Software Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science
	+ MA/MS Degree preferred
* Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in product management and/or development
* Healthcare IT experience strongly preferred
* Experience communicating market need to technical resources and communicating technical constraints to clients
* Experience driving compelling enterprise-grade solutions from concept to market, with proven success growing in highly competitive and regulated industries


**Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities**


* Proven experience leading product development teams
* Prior expertise in establishing and optimizing a PM function
* Exceptional executive and strategic relationship management with internal and external stakeholders
* Understands and uses analytical analysis and methods to see insights in data
* Excellent management skills with proven experience managing software product migrations and creating innovative products to drive and capture white space in industry
* Have a good working knowledge of different SDLCs and how that relates to the Product Management function
* High level of expertise in software product design and usability, regulatory and interoperability functions
* Excellent time management, communication, decision-making, presentation, inter-personal skills, and organization skills
* Exemplify the Greenway core values of Excellence, Agility, Service, Integrity, Accountability and Business Acumen
* Collaborative and mission-oriented leadership style
* Active listener with ability to drive consensus and act decisively
* Ability to build and collaborate with high performance teams around a common vision and mission and can consistently deliver on a set of challenging goals
* Proven ability to create enterprise value and revenue through product enhancements and new product development
* The ability to clearly direct, persuade, motivate, sell and gain trust and confidence through verbal and written communications


**Work Environment/Physical Demands**


* While at work, this position is primarily a sedentary job and requires that the associate can work in an environment where they will consistently be seated for most of the workday
* This role requires that one can sit and regularly type on a keyboard most of their workday
* This position requires the ability to observe a computer screen for extended periods of time to observe their own and others’ work, as well as in-coming and out-going communications via the computer and/ or mobile devices.
* The role necessitates the ability to listen and speak clearly to customers and other associates


Here’s what we can offer you in exchange for your amazing work:


* Competitive pay
* Medical, dental and vision benefits
* Matching 401(k)
* Generous paid time-off programs
* Education reimbursement
* Growth potential for your career
* Corporate discounts


At Greenway, we strive to imagine, empower, engage, and inspire. Join us!



To learn more about Greenway, take a video tour of our office, and meet our employees, visit us at www.GreenwayHealth.com/careers.
