title: Associate Product Manager
description:
**About LeafLink**
------------------



LeafLink is the largest unified B2B cannabis platform, providing licensed cannabis businesses a suite of tools to manage their business more effectively, sell or order from their favorite brands and accelerate growth. We are one platform, one solution and we're defining the way thousands of cannabis brands, distributors and retailers streamline their operations. With thousands of brands and retailers across 30+ markets in North America, we are setting the industry standard for how cannabis businesses grow together. LeafLink processes more than $4.4 billion in wholesale cannabis orders annually.



Our team, backed by funding from leading VC's, including Founders Fund, Thrive Capital, Nosara Capital, and Lerer Hippeau is poised to define the cannabis supply chain through technology. LeafLink was named one of Inc. 5000's 'Top 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies', one of Built In NYC's 'Best Places to Work in 2021', as well as one of Fast Company's 'Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Enterprise for 2020', joining the ranks of Amazon, Slack, and VMWare - and we're just getting started!

**The Role**
------------



We are looking for a growing associate product manager to join LeafLink's product organization early in their career. As a LeafLink Product Manager, you will work closely with experienced product managers to refine your product management skills, while owning your portion of the LeafLink platform.



You will work closely with product designers, engineers, stakeholders, and others to build and launch various experiences, capabilities, and features for LeafLink customers. You will also support sprint planning, roadmap constructions, retrospectives, and maintaining a backlog of ready-to-go stories, tasks, and bugs.


**What You'll Be Doing**
------------------------


* Contribute to and support the planning, prioritization, and implementation of various functionality and capabilities for LeafLink's cannabis platform
* Work closely with various LeafLink teams and customer feedback to identify areas to improve the user experience
* Write user stories, organize bugs, and review UX/UI designs in close coordination with the development team and product teammates
* Own and maintain a prioritized product backlog and collaborate daily with our engineering team to execute
* Act as the point person for escalation and resolution during the product lifecycle as it relates to bugs and enhancements within your scope
* Determine and provide a necessary level of documentation as well as work with other teams to produce sales and marketing collateral
* Track product KPIs and analyze user data to evaluate adoption
* Oversee sprints, retrospects, and similar Agile-based ceremonies
* Stay informed and ahead of industry trends, advancements, and competitor capabilities

**What You'll Bring to the Team**
---------------------------------


* Inspired by LeafLink's vision, mission, and value system we are committed to driving us toward these pursuits daily.
* At least two years in a product-focused role for an e-commerce, enterprise, or SaaS software product.
* Passionate about delighting users by creating a wonderful experience
* Customer-centric orientation with experience developing and acting on customer insights
* Ability to define opportunities and problems, collect and analyze data, establish facts, and make valid conclusions
* Ability to work effectively both in a team environment and independently
* Proven experience communicating effectively across roles and teams
* Prior startup experience is a plus
* Prior Agile software development experience is a plus

**LeafLink Perks & Benefits**
-----------------------------


* **Flexible PTO** - you're going to be working hard so enjoy time off with no cap!
* A robust **stock option plan** to give our employees a direct stake in LeafLink's success
* **5 Days of Volunteer Time Off (VTO)** - giving back is important to us and we want our employees to prioritize cultivating a better community
* **Competitive compensation** and **401k**
* Comprehensive **health** **coverage** (medical, dental, vision)
* **Commuter Benefits** through our Flexible Spending Account


*LeafLink's employee-centric culture has earned us a coveted spot on**BuiltInNYC's Best Places to Work for in 2021 list.* *Learn more about LeafLink's history and the path to our First Billion in Wholesale Cannabis Orders**here**.*

**Base salary range**


$75,000—$100,000 USD

title: Software Development Manager – Home Infusion Pharmacy
description:
ResMed has always applied the best of technology to improve people's lives. Now our SaaS technology is fueling a new era in the healthcare industry, with dynamic systems that change the way people receive care in settings outside of the hospital–and tools that work every day to help people stay well, longer. We have one of the largest actionable datasets in the industry, creating a complete view of people as they move between care settings. This is how we empower providers–with vital insight to deliver the care people need, right when they need it.
We're also ensuring that our health solutions connect to other companies' networks. Because when objectives align, everyone wins. And as we work today to drive better care and lower costs, we're developing more personalized solutions for tomorrow, utilizing machine learning, intelligent care paths, and predictive protocols. If you are an innovator who wants to make an impact we want to talk to you! We have exciting opportunities supporting Brightree by ResMed and MatrixCare by ResMed!
Let’s talk about the team
Brightree, a ResMed company is headquartered just outside of Atlanta. Brightree’s team of more than 600 employees is thinking, creating, and challenging ourselves to better serve our patients and customers. Each day is a new day for ground-breaking ideas and unparalleled opportunity. Ours is a culture focused on what we can accomplish today, and where it can lead us tomorrow.
Our Software as a Service (SaaS) business is an exciting new area of growth focused on the full continuum of out-of-hospital care settings. The team is building a global portfolio of connected software and services designed to drive more choices and better outcomes for patients and providers. We are looking for individuals with a strategic mindset, business acumen, an entrepreneurial outlook, strong technical capabilities and a “get it done” attitude to help fulfill our vision as the leader in out of hospital solutions.
The Pharmacy team identifies, engineers, delivers, and supports a best-in-class software solution for specialty pharmacies. We’re a team of thinkers and innovators who constantly challenge ourselves to do everything better than the day before. We provide a solution that improves patient outcomes and delights our partners and customers.
The Software Development Manager is a key role in the Brightree Technology Pharmacy team. This role focuses on clear ownership of our product from cradle-to-grave. Development responsibilities include analysis, design, programming, performance, security, quality assurance, and Tier 3 support. This pivotal role serves to guarantee delivered technical solutions meet the needs of the Brightree Organization with specific focus on Development, Quality Assurance, Security, Product, Implementation, Support, and Documentation Teams.
Let’s talk about the Responsibilities* Design, develop and test software; Verify software behavior meets requirements through manual and automated tests; Deliver quality product within timeline; Document product design; Analyze, debug and help resolve customer issues; Collaborate and communicate effectively with all stakeholders.
* Direct reporting responsibility for multiple pharmacy teams made up of Software Development and Quality engineers.
* Focuses on the development and implementation of strategic and operational objectives that help achieve organizational mission. Implements organization strategies through the effective direction and management of employees and resources.
* Leads architectural design and coordinate with software engineering directors and managers as necessary for a consistent approach within the suite of applications.
* Active participation in all aspects of the agile process including, but not limited to story reviews, sprint planning, daily standups and retrospectives.
* Often leads a cooperative effort among members of cross-functional project teams.
* Coaches team members on performance, provide inputs for performance evaluations and involved in pay actions.


Let’s talk about you  

* 5+ years of experience mentoring software engineering resources, preferably for a software company using Microsoft technologies in a web-based application.
* Experience designing and developing large-scale web applications in an agile environment
* 5+ years of experience with MS SQL Server (TSQL/SQL) in a high-volume transaction environment
* Strong object-oriented knowledge and practical experience with design patterns
* Practical experience with source code configuration, versioning and promotion
* Experience working in a SaaS model
* Experience working in environments with a DevOps Culture and exposure to Continuous Delivery


Preferred:* Proven pharmacy domain expertise.
* Bachelor’s degree.
* Applies acquired expertise and exercises judgment to analyze and solve problems without clear precedent.
* Analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors.


#LI-LL1
We are shaping the future at ResMed, and we recognize the need to build on and broaden our existing skills and continue to attract and retain the world’s best talent. We work hard to offer holistic benefits packages, provide flexible work arrangements, cultivate a workforce culture that allows employees to grow personally and professionally, and deliver competitive salaries to our team members. Employees scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible for benefits. This position qualifies for the following benefits package: comprehensive medical, vision, dental, and life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance, sleep care management, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), commuter benefits, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and tuition assistance. Employees accrue three weeks Paid Time Off (PTO) in their first year of employment, receive 11 paid holidays plus 3 floating days and are eligible for 14 weeks of primary caregiver or two weeks of secondary caregiver leave when welcoming new family members. Individual pay decisions are based on a variety of factors, such as the candidate’s geographic work location, relevant qualifications, work experience, and skills.
This role is eligible to receive an annual cash bonus payment based on company, business unit, and/or individual performance.
Base Pay Range for this position:
$121,000 - $181,000
Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Manager, User Acceptance Testing
description:
**Company Overview:**



Cohere Health is illuminating healthcare for patients, their doctors, and all those who are important in a patient's healthcare experience, both in and out of the doctors office. Founded in August, 2019, we are obsessed with eliminating wasteful friction patients and doctors experience in areas that have nothing to do with health and treatment, particularly for diagnoses that require expensive procedures or medications. To that end, we build software that is expressly designed to ensure the appropriate plan of care is understood and expeditiously approved, so that patients and doctors can focus on health, rather than payment or administrative hassles.


**Opportunity Overview:**



The Manager, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) plays a critical role in ensuring the quality and functionality of software applications by overseeing the User Acceptance Testing process. The Manager, UAT is responsible for coordinating and managing all aspects of UAT, ensuring that the testing activities align with project objectives and meet quality standards. This role requires strong leadership, communication, and analytical skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Last but not least: People who succeed here are empathetic teammates who are candid, kind, caring, and embody our core values and principles. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams make the most impactful work. Cohere is deeply invested in ensuring that we have a supportive, growth-oriented environment that works for everyone.


**What you will do:**  

  

**Strategy and Planning:**


* Develop and implement UAT strategies, plans, and timelines in coordination with project management and development teams.
* Collaborate with business analysts, project managers, and other stakeholders to define UAT scope, objectives, and success criteria.


**Team Management:**


* Lead and mentor a team of UA testers, providing guidance on testing methodologies, test case design, and execution.
* Assign responsibilities, monitor progress, and ensure the team adheres to testing standards and best practices


**Test Planning and Design:**


* Work closely with business analysts to translate business requirements into comprehensive and effective test cases.


**Collaboration:**


* Communicate effectively with business stakeholders, development teams, and other QA team members to ensure a shared understanding of testing objectives.
* Participate in walkthroughs and meetings to address questions and provide clarity on requirements.


**Documentation:**


* Maintain detailed records of test cases, test results, and defect reports.
* Create and update testing documentation as needed.


**Regression Testing:**


* Perform regression testing to ensure that new features or changes do not adversely impact existing functionality.
* Document and report any regression issues to the development team.


**Communication:**


* Provide regular updates on UAT progress, including test execution status, issues, and risk mitigation.
* Report and escalate critical issues to the UAT Leader and project stakeholders in a timely manner.


**Quality Assurance:**


* Adhere to established testing methodologies, processes, and best practices.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of UAT processes.


**Your background & requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent experience required
* Proven experience in user acceptance testing or a similar quality assurance role
* Familiarity with software development life cycle (SDLC) and testing methodologies
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results
* Certification in software testing (e.g., ISTQB), strongly preferred


**We can't wait to learn more about you and meet you at Cohere Health!**


**Equal Opportunity Statement:**



Cohere Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all. To us, it's personal.



The salary range for this position is $125,000 to $140,000 annually; as part of a total benefits package which includes health insurance, 401k and bonus. In accordance with state applicable laws, Cohere is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Individual pay decisions are ultimately based on a number of factors, including but not limited to qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, and internal alignment.

  



#LI-Remote



#BI-Remote

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
(This is a REMOTE Role)


WATCH THIS VIDEO (https://www.loom.com/share/220c0c5cefe14db2b02c6f0f0e9b5627?sid=9727f1a4-81c2-4590-b2eb-25cab734ef29)


Are you a Product Manager looking to make an impact by joining a healthcare tech startup that is disrupting the broken healthcare system?


If so, we have a role for you!


**We're looking for a hungry, “I want to build products that make a massive difference” type of person.** You are user-focused, think in terms of key performance indicators (KPIs), and love bringing simplicity and elegance to complex problems. You thrive in a fast-growth startup environment and can swim through feedback and user interviews to uncover hidden gems.


As a Product Manager, help develop our software that generates patients for our customers. You will be responsible for driving product design, implementing tracking metrics, creating the product roadmap and working closely with the engineering team to implement the product.


This role is for you if you:


* Have loads of grit. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and pursue something hands-on, you persevere when others fall away.
* Lead with empathy. You work backwards from a customer problem to find the real solutions our customers need.
* Decide with data. You are an analytical problem solver, driven by data.


Breakthrough and our community of pioneering Physical Therapy private practice owners are united by the purpose of helping people in pain get back to normal naturally through Physical Therapy and other natural solutions instead of unnecessary pain medication or surgery.


Breakthrough is the leader in business growth for Physical Therapy private practices through marketing services and business coaching. Our clients have an average annual practice growth rate of 33%. Every month, our system drives over 10,000 direct access patients into our member practices.


Our people are the heart and soul of our success. We are passionate, dedicated, and driven. Our teammates have the grit to get things done in ambiguous environments, the teamwork drive to put the team ahead of self, and the desire to continue to learn and grow throughout their careers.


If you are passionate about helping people get back to health naturally, and you love to work for a driven company, we want to talk to you!


**What you'll do:**


* You will own our product research by conducting thorough customer interviews to gather insights and generate innovative ideas. You will evaluate features based on value metrics and collaborate on prioritization. You will develop feedback systems and maintain the product roadmap.
* You will own product requirements by creating detailed epics and user stories, refining wireframes with team and customer feedback. You will work closely with engineering to translate requirements and stay ahead of sprint cycles.
* You will facilitate the scrum process. You will serve as product owner and scrum master, leading sprint activities and release planning. You will ensure timely delivery and clear communication with stakeholders.
* You will own quality assurance by defining test criteria and managing bug tracking across departments. You will conduct tests and prioritize fixes efficiently.
* You will increase product adoption and customer value by promoting feature value internally and externally, execute rollout plans, optimize features through customer feedback, and measure outcomes for continuous improvement.


**What we're looking for:**


* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment
* Attention to detail and comfort solving ambiguous product problems
* Deep understanding of software development and how to use analytics to improve products.
* Proficient in defining well thought out user stories, with thorough acceptance criteria and use cases.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to drive alignment among multiple stakeholders


**Why Breakthrough**


You will be part of a transformative company. Our mission is to help people in pain get back to normal naturally (instead of overusing pharmaceuticals or getting unnecessary surgery).


**Other Awesome Benefits About This Opportunity**


* Completely virtual. We don't have an office (and never have). We care about your results and impact on the business and want our team to live and work wherever they want.
* We have an amazing team of incredibly driven people who are constantly learning, growing, and encouraging one another.
* Amazing benefits, including healthcare, matching 401K, and shares in our employee stock ownership trust.
* Work life balance environment - we care that you are personally and professionally taken care of.


**Our Values = Your Values:**


This is for you only if you align with our values:


Elevate Others


Be Real


Beginners' Mind


Own The Results


Up for the Challenge


Driven


Seeks to Understand the Customer First

title: End to End Tester
description:
Overview: As an End-to-End Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of software systems by testing them across their entire lifecycle, from inception to deployment. You'll work closely with development teams, product managers, and stakeholders to identify test requirements, execute test cases, and ensure the seamless operation of applications.

Key Responsibilities:

* Test Planning: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop comprehensive test plans, defining test objectives, strategies, and scope for end-to-end testing.
* Test Case Design: Create detailed, efficient test cases covering various scenarios, edge cases, and user workflows to validate system functionalities across the entire software ecosystem.
* Execution and Documentation: Perform testing activities, including functional, regression, integration, and performance testing, meticulously documenting test results, issues found, and resolutions.
* Defect Management: Identify, report, and track defects using designated tools or systems, collaborating with the development team to resolve issues and ensure the timely delivery of high-quality software.
* Automation: Develop and maintain automated test scripts to streamline testing processes, increase test coverage, and improve efficiency.
* Environment Setup: Set up and maintain test environments to simulate production-like scenarios for accurate testing.
* Collaboration: Work closely with developers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, provide feedback, and ensure alignment between development and testing efforts.

Skills and Qualifications:

* Proven experience as an End-to-End Tester or in a similar role within software testing.
* Proficiency in test planning, test case design, and execution methodologies.
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and testing principles.
* Hands-on experience with testing tools (e.g., Cypress, Selenium, JIRA, etc.) and proficiency in test automation.
* Solid knowledge of various testing types such as functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams.

Additional Qualifications (Preferred):

* Certification in software testing (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) or relevant certifications.
* Knowledge of programming languages (Java, Python, etc.) for test automation.

- Understanding of Agile software development methodologies  
- Ability to analyze and troubleshoot issues using tools like Carbonise or GitLab  
- Strong SQL skills for writing PL/SQL queries  
- Familiarity with build tools like Ant or Maven  
- Knowledge of Waterfall software development methodology

Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. Other duties may be assigned as necessary to meet business needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,431.30 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance

title: Software Development Manager
Business Analyst - Lending Software (Remote)
description:
Do you have an eye for detail and enjoy analyzing software features? Would you find joy out of writing lending software requirements and working alongside other technical individuals? Join our team!



As our **Business Analyst** you will be using your skills and expertise to problem solve and architect challenging, new solutions for our software. You'll be responsible for using your knowledge in alternative finance while researching, planning, and designing software specifications for our customers.

  


**The Company**



Hi, we’re Infinity, a part of Constellation Software Group (TSX:CSU). We operate independently building high end financial software for lending companies. We’re pushing to use financial technology to revolutionize the way people lend and borrow money. Nice to meet you!

  


**The Gig**



You’ll join our Product team and work alongside other BA’s, Project Managers, Software Engineers, and more. Your primary responsibilities will be the following:


* Identify customer and business requirements through research and data collection. Our software products are well defined and built according to the customer's and stakeholder's wants and needs.
* Identify, communicate, and manage risk vs potential upside associated with features and products. Risks are identified and mitigated for each feature and product release.
* Translate requirements into new information technology project specifications. Customer and stakeholder feedback is used to create products and features that truly serve them.
* Assist with project plans for development and testing. Project plans are created based on customer feedback and needs.

  


**Skills & Experience**


* 2+ years of experience in a Business Analyst role
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field
* Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
* Experience writing software requirements and presenting information to various teams
* Strong communicator and works adaptively with our team

  


**The Team**



Our company is small but is growing extremely fast so we can only afford to have the absolute best people. We have a fun, laid back environment. Our team is packed full of high performing, happy, driven, individuals. If that’s the kind of team you’d like to work with, you’ll do well here.

  


**The Culture**



We do everything based on our Company Values (We will show you these when you interview with us). We believe in working hard, having fun, and enjoying life. We believe that work should make our lives better and help us reach our goals as individuals and as a team.

  


**The Easy 5 Step Interview Process**



* Send in your application


* We’ll schedule a phone interview


* Polish your webcam lens, dress up (you can still wear your slippers, no one will know), and jump on two virtual interviews with our team


* Accept the position


* Be proud!
  



Infinity promotes equal employment opportunities for all. Infinity does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, marital status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business need.



Apply now!

title: Product Designer (contract)
description:
**Product Designer (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**


The Bing Search & Design System team is looking for a Product Designer to help bring our projects to life. This role is for someone with strong design abilities, typographic skills, digital expertise, and acute attention to detail. You are a highly motivated, self-directed team player who works well under pressure and can thrive in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment. Development of visual design concepts referencing our visual system and interface guidelines and sharing those with the visual system designers. You are also capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously. You are a great creator, collaborator, and communicator.  



  

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead collaborative design for your assigned product area across designers, researchers, product managers, and developers.
* Conduct or participate in basic research to understand the behaviors, motivations, and needs of our customers and then utilize this knowledge to develop relevant and impactful experiences.
* Work closely with product teams to understand strategic planning and ensure your work aligns to business goals while creating customer value.
* Draw upon your ability to map end-to-end experiences and ideate broadly to generate creative solutions to complex user scenarios and business needs.
* Propose creative solutions to complex problems.
* Utilize your strong interaction and visual design skills to create amazing product designs.
* Document final designs in a point-of-reference/specification, adjust design systems and work directly with engineers for implementation.

 **Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Graphic Design, or related program. A combination of education and experience may substitute for a Bachelor's degree.
* 5-7+ years of visual UI design/Graphic design for website/mobile apps and work-related experience required.
* Have a good understanding of UX (user experience, web, and mobile interaction patterns). Strong visual/UI design skills.
* Ability to discuss and present an in-depth knowledge of standard design principles: color, typography, layout, brand.
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work under constant deadline constraints.
* Must have the ability to understand technology issues and communicate information effectively.
* Proficiency in current and emerging web technologies and standard design software packages (i.e. Figma)

Portfolio for a review with design lead.  
* 

  

**Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 4 months
* Pay Range: $46.50 - 52.50 per hour

  



  

*AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Senior Software Development Manager, Mobile
description:
**About the team**
------------------


At Follow Up Boss, we're on a mission to help real estate businesses convert more of their leads into deals. We believe in creating simple, effective, and high-quality tools that make our customers' lives easier and their businesses more profitable. Our team is fully remote and we pride ourselves on our collaborative, supportive, and customer-centric approach. We are guided by our core values of teamwork, communication, code quality, focus and prioritization, and customer-driven innovation.**About the role**
------------------


As the Mobile Engineering Manager, you will lead our iOS and Android development teams, driving the vision and execution of our mobile-first strategy. You will play a crucial role in transforming our mobile experiences, transitioning away from web views towards native mobile experiences, and creating compelling experiences for our users.

**Your responsibilities will include:**
---------------------------------------

* Managing a team of iOS and Android engineers, providing guidance, and ensuring successful project outcomes.
* Cultivating leadership skills within your team by fostering an inclusive environment and offering opportunities for growth and development.
* Driving the vision and strategy for mobile-first development, prioritizing a native experience while balancing the need for speed-to-market for customer-facing features.
* Upholding a high standard of mobile excellence, working closely with other teams to utilize and improve best-in-class mobile technology.
* Fostering strong cross-functional relationships across the organization to promote collaboration and ensure alignment on project goals.
* Participating in hiring and sourcing to build a diverse, high-performance engineering team.
* Collaborating with product and design leadership to define and prioritize projects that help us meet business objectives.
* Ensuring the software your team delivers is of high quality, reliable, secure, and maintainable.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $197,100.00 - $314,900.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* At least 5 years of management experience, with a proven track record of developing and leading high-performing engineering teams.
* At least 5 years of experience building mobile applications, with a working knowledge of both Swift and Kotlin programming languages and expertise in one of the two.
* Passion for mentoring, growing the potential of others, and supporting direct reports.
* An iterative approach to software development combined with the commitment to ownership, moving fast and thinking big.
* Self-motivated with the ability to thrive in fast-paced, complex environments with minimal oversight.
* Collaborative working style with a strong focus on execution and results.
* Deep commitment to our core values of teamwork, communication, code quality, focus and prioritization, and customer-driven

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Test Engineer (E-commerce Platform)
description:
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Test Engineer to join our dynamic team responsible for testing our e-commerce platform ComAve (comave.com). As a Test Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our platform by designing and executing comprehensive test plans, identifying and documenting defects, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions to our customers.

**Responsibilities:**

1. Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts to verify the functionality, usability, and performance of our e-commerce platform.

2. Conduct manual and automated testing of web applications, APIs, and database integrations to identify defects and ensure compliance with functional requirements.

3. Collaborate with software developers, product managers, and business stakeholders to understand product requirements and translate them into test cases and acceptance criteria.

4. Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint retrospectives, to provide input on testing strategies and priorities.

5. Perform regression testing to validate software changes and ensure backward compatibility with existing features and functionalities.

6. Document test results, defects, and issues in a clear and concise manner, and work with development teams to prioritize and resolve identified issues.

7. Continuously improve testing processes, methodologies, and tools to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness of testing activities.

8. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in software testing, quality assurance, and e-commerce technologies, and proactively apply this knowledge to drive improvements in our testing practices.

**Requirements:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

2. 3+ years of proven experience as a Test Engineer or Quality Assurance Engineer in an e-commerce and web application development environment.

3. Solid understanding of software testing methodologies, test automation tools, and defect tracking systems.

4. Proficiency in writing and executing test cases, test scripts, and test scenarios for web applications, APIs, and database systems.

5. Experience with test automation frameworks and tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar.

6. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and identify root causes.

7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.

8. Self-motivated, proactive, and detail-oriented, with a strong commitment to delivering high-quality software solutions.

9. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and version control systems (Git) is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience level:

* 3 years

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Test Engineer or Quality Assurance: 3 years (Preferred)
* Test automation: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Development Manager, EDI
description:
What are important things that YOU need to know about this role?* This role is eligible to be full-time, permanent remote
* Deep experience with EDI is required
* Experience with insurance strongly preferred
* This person will oversee a team of four individuals. Experience with managing a remote team is preferred.


What will YOU be doing for us? Oversee staff responsible for design and development of EDI processes within our Enterprise System architecture. Lead the development of new EDI processes based on the HIPAA standards and provide support for all existing processes. Drive innovation and transformation of our EDI processes using modern and cloud enabled technologies.
What will YOU be working on every day?* Lead the transformation and cloud migration of existing EDI processes.
* Work collaboratively with internal resources to assess and understand technical specifications and business requirements for new or enhanced integrations.
* Provide necessary feedback to internal staff regarding system capabilities to ensure specifications and requirements can be met.
* Provide support and maintain current modules by responding to complex and escalated operational concerns.
* Oversee thorough documentation of all system specifications, designs and descriptions to ensure shared understanding with internal stakeholders.
* Collaborate with development team members to help establish estimates once discovery is completed.
* Oversee accurate creation of use cases and unit tests to allow internal teams to provide thorough testing.
* Work collaboratively with internal team members on investigating and fixing defects.
* Communicate with stakeholders for the purposes of troubleshooting issues with new system implementations or system enhancements.
* Work in conjunction with Human Resources to evaluate viable candidates under consideration for hire by identifying necessary skills and core competencies for various roles, developing relevant interview questions to assess candidate knowledge, skill, and position fit with future growth and business objectives, and utilizing appropriate selection techniques.
* Develop, and motivate staff. Initiate and communicate a variety of personnel actions including employment, termination, performance reviews, salary reviews, disciplinary actions, and development plans. Provide regular and behaviorally specific feedback to increase performance levels.
* Develop and implement appropriate training methods to ensure staff is provided with the appropriate tools to meet client requirements and objectives.
* Work effectively and collaboratively with peers and other internal resources in diagnosing and resolving issues.
* Update director on any significant issues in relation to development.
* Foster an environment of autonomy, continuous improvement, and excellence.


Additional Responsibilities:* Develop new processes for currently unsupported HIPAA standards.
* Perform diagnostics of existing processes.
* Perform performance and optimization analysis.
* Provide technical advice to lead and/or support new and existing client implementation and maintenance.
* Provide technical assistance to other internal teams.
* Maintain responsibility for timely and accurate project completion.
* Help analyze requests from internal and external clients to determine scope of request and determine requirements to successfully complete the request.
* Properly communicate technical information to internal and external clients to ensure shared understanding.
* Assess the quality of data contained within system databases.
* Research technologies to enhance process performance.
* Research, define, and implement new methods to modify the system to improve workflows.
* Perform routine and ad hoc data maintenance.


What qualifications do YOU need to have to be a GOOD candidate?* Required Level of Education, Licenses, and/or Certificates
	+ Requires a Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related degree or equivalent years of internal experience.
* Required Level of Experience
	+ 7+ years of related hands-on EDI experience.
	+ Previous experience in EDI modernization initiatives.
	+ Previous experience in successful technical training of co-workers.
	+ 2+ years of prior experience in managing and/or leading others
* Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
	+ Knowledge of health care HIPAA standards
		- 837 (D, P, I) – Electronic Claims
		- 834 – Benefit Enrollment
		- 276/277 – Claim Status Inquiry and Response
		- 270/271 – Eligibility Benefit Inquiry and Response
		- 835 – Electronic Remittance Advice
		- 277CA – Claims Acknowledgement
		- 999 – Functional Acknowledgement
		- 278 – Authorization and Referral Request
* Knowledge of EDI Processing
* Knowledge of modern EDI
	+ Strong knowledge of MS SSIS/SSRS
	+ Strong knowledge of MS stored procedures
	+ Strong knowledge of database application and data query protocol (MS SQL Server, Transact-SQL).
	+ Strong knowledge of C#
	+ Strong knowledge of PowerShell
	+ Strong knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
	+ Ability to successfully manage projects to successful outcomes and within required timeframes.
	+ Basic knowledge of health and benefits industry


What qualifications do YOU need to have to be a GREAT candidate?* Preferred Level of Education, License, and/or Certificates
	+ Bachelor’s Degree
* Preferred Level of Experience
	+ Previous experience using 3rd party EDI tools for generating HIPAA X12 files
	+ Familiarity with the HL7 Standards
	+ Previous healthcare management experience.
* Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
	+ Working knowledge of modern EDI solution providers and packages.
	+ Event-driven architectures and messaging technologies.


The salary range and midpoint is listed below for your reference. Please keep in mind that your education and experience along with your knowledge, skills and abilities are taken into consideration when determining placement within the range.
Compensation Range:
$138,736.00 - $208,104.00
Compensation Midpoint:
$173,420.00

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
**Job Description:** We are looking for a dynamic and passionate Junior Product Manager to join our product management team. In this role, you will work closely with senior product managers to develop and implement product strategies that align with our company's vision and customer needs.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist in the development and implementation of product roadmaps and strategies.
* Coordinate and analyze market research to identify customer needs and market trends.
* Collaborate with the engineering, design, and marketing teams to develop and launch new features and products.
* Analyze product performance and user feedback to recommend improvements.
* Contribute to sprint planning and review sessions.
* Prepare and present reports on product progress and roadmap updates.
* Assist in managing product backlogs and prioritizing feature development.
* Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure product goals are met on time and within budget.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
* 0-2 years of experience in product management, project management, or a related field in the software industry.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools such as DevOps.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Passion for technology and innovation.

  



About Persimmony:



Persimmony is a leading software company working primarily with state and county health and social service departments. We provide electronic case management and other tracking software for government employees who provide critical care for county residents.



Founded in 2002, we are well established and have a proven track record of success in over two dozen counties, where we have helped our customers save hundreds of millions of dollars.



We are based in Aliso Viejo, CA, but are committed to 100% remote work as we continue to scale out our services nationally.



Persimmony is an equal opportunity employer, committed to cultural diversity. Persimmony will provide equal consideration for employment to all qualified applicants without regard to their race, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, or medical condition. Persimmony is an E-Verify participant.

title: Product Manager
description:
Greenshades Product Managers are responsible for executing Agile based software development across multiple product verticals whilst maintaining true ownership of their products and scrum teams.


The Product Management Department is aiming to hire professionals that have a combination of hard and soft skills that are valuable within a development organization. These professionals should expect to interact, manage, and communicate effectively across departmental boundaries, to external partners, and directly with users of the product. You should be comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Structure and processes are crucial, but as a results driven PM, flexibility is essential to ensure you are properly prioritizing the enhancements that will enable new revenue and maintain a high level of satisfaction for the active customer base. We expect you to be passionate about building products that our customers love.


We are looking for a technically talented and data driven individual with a moderate level of experience within the Payroll / HCM space who seeks to enhance the products they take ownership of and grow their own skillsets.

**Responsibilities**

* Define and develop the product strategy / roadmap to drive targeted business outcomes in alignment with top level corporate strategies / goals.
* Identify new product features to solve problems that current and prospective clients are facing, through market or internal information via interactions with clients, sales, implementations, or other functional internal or external departments.
* Nurture the technical relationships with key customers through various avenues (i.e. conducting voice of the customer feedback sessions).
* Daily leadership and management of the Sprinting or KanBan processes of assigned scrum teams.
* Present complex information, issues, processes, and potential solutions in an organized and summarized fashion to leadership, interested parties, and team members with the goal of producing buy in and cross team alignment.
* Identify market opportunities and build business cases, including financial estimates, to own the P&L
* Build a highly skilled and engaged development workforce.
* Create User Story definitions and specifications and in turn define the “what to build” and “why we should build it” side of the development cycle.
* Define, analyze, and manage metrics that track the success of managed products (KPIs)
* Effectively and efficiently communicate product changes both internally for stakeholders and externally for users.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Must display the highest level of critical thinking to weigh alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with the business strategy.
* Superior leadership abilities including the ability to share knowledge, resolve conflict, and create consensus.
* Strong ability to take ownership of assigned tasks and responsibilities, and appropriately prioritize.
* Excellent strategic project planning and documentation skills.
* Logical, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills.
* Well versed in software development, web applications, computer architecture, and related subject matter.
* A passion for data, with great quantitative skills. Fully comfortable with financial and operational metrics and analyses.
* Must think like a both with strong business acumen as well as problem solver or engineer by displaying strong troubleshooting abilities to get to the source of problems and think critically about the potential solutions impact both technically and practically.
* Must display initiative, ability to work independently and be able to use extensive independent judgment.
* Ability to work seamlessly within a team as well as manage individual tasks.
* Ability to react quickly to a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Focus on the customer; Celebrates the success of others in the business.
* Working knowledge of the Payroll and HCM software market, with an intermediate level of core payroll and tax concepts.

**Preferred Training and Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in a related area required (or equivalent work experience).
* A minimum of 4+ years of experience in a software development environment, preferably as a Product Owner, Product Manager, Business Analyst, or equivalent, with an HCM or Payroll industry focus.
* Proven track record of developing and implementing winning technology strategies within a large, complex organization.
* Proven track record overseeing all aspects of large-scale projects including planning, requirements gathering, resource management and budget.
* Experience in Agile based software development.
* Technical knowledge of Information Technology field, software development, and computer systems.
* Familiarity with the following Product Management and/ or software development toolsets; Azure DevOps, SQL Syntax, Pendo, Miro / Figma / Lucid, and Postman


This is a remote position.

title: Project Manager IV
description:
We are hiring a Project Manager to join the Net Zero team. This role will help support the net zero supplier engagement program with a strong focus on supplier engagement, internal collaboration and building analysis to support value chain emissions reduction by 2030. We are looking for smart and flexible candidates who are enthusiastic about working on cross functional teams, have strong analytical skills, with critical thinking abilities and exemplary communication skills. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of GHG accounting including scope 3, supplier engagement on sustainability, GHG target setting and roadmap development in a fast paced, dynamic tech environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Drive engagement strategies with selected suppliers on value chain GHG emissions reduction.
* Analyze supplier GHG data, targets, roadmaps and solutions for trends, projections and decision-making.
* Coordinate with internal stakeholders (e.g. procurement teams and supplier managers) to deliver timely projects
* Scale the impact of suppliers and internal initiatives to accelerate value chain GHG emissions reduction.
* Partner with cross functional teams to support the development and execution of new and existing GHG reduction initiatives.
* Effectively communicate program progress internally.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Undergraduate degree in business, supply chain, environmental science, or related field.
* 3-4 years of related experience in supply chain management.
* Expertise in Contract negotiations, Supplier Management, Roadmap development, GHG accounting, and GHG target setting.
* Strong analytical capabilities and ability to manage complex data, advanced Excel and data analytics proficiency.
* Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to self-manage complex delivery in a fast-paced, matrixed environment.
* A team player and strategic thinker who can ideate and help us scale initiatives that accelerate scope 3 GHG emissions reduction with suppliers.
* A self starter, with a proven ability to diplomatically resolve issues through understanding conflicting inputs, achieving alignment, and proposing go-forward solutions.
* Experience working with interdisciplinary teams (e.g. Sustainability, Procurement Teams, Business teams, Engineering) and managing relationships with complex stakeholders.
* Demonstrated flexibility and ability and willingness to learn and work on projects.
* Familiarity with global and sectoral sustainability initiatives.
* Strong understanding of products and services.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
* Ability to travel (10%).

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in related field (e.g. MBA, Master’s in Supply Chain, Sustainability Management).
* GHG software and tools operation experience.
* Tableau proficiency.
* Proficiency in electrical and electronics manufacturing sector.

**Benefits:**

* 401(k).
* Dental Insurance.
* Health insurance.
* Vision insurance.
* We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity, equality, inclusion, and respect for people.
* The salary will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, location, relevant education, qualifications, experience, technical skills, and business needs.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* Participate in OrangePeople monthly team meetings, and participate in team-building efforts.
* Contribute to OrangePeople technical discussions, peer reviews, etc.
* Contribute content and collaborate via the OP-Wiki/Knowledge Base.
* Provide status reports to OP Account Management as requested.

**About us:**   
OrangePeople is an Enterprise Architecture and Project Management solutions company. Our most valuable asset is our people: dynamic, creative thinkers, who are passionate about doing quality work. As a member of the OrangePeople team, you will have access to industry-leading consulting practices, strategies & and technologies, innovative training & and education. An ideal Orange Person is a technology leader with a proven track record of technical achievements and a strong process/methodology orientation.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you require sponsorship for this role?

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Support Manager
description:
**Job Posting: Software Support Manager**

**Company Overview:**  
Traumasoft is a leading provider of software solutions tailored for Emergency Medical Service (EMS) providers. Our cutting-edge technology aims to streamline operations, enhance efficiency, and ultimately improve patient care within the EMS industry. We are committed to innovation and excellence, continually striving to exceed the expectations of our clients.

**Position: Software Support Manager**

**Location:** Remote

**Job Type:** Full-time

**Overview:**  
We are seeking an experienced Software Support Manager to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software support management, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for creating and refining support processes and systems. As the Software Support Manager, you will lead a team responsible for providing exceptional support to our clients, ensuring their needs are met promptly and effectively.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage a team of software support specialists, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction.
* Develop and implement new processes and systems to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the software support team.
* Utilize tools such as Zendesk, Jira, phone, and email to manage support tickets and inquiries, ensuring timely resolution and communication with clients.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Development and Quality Assurance, to address escalated issues and ensure timely resolution.
* Establish and monitor metrics and benchmarks to evaluate the performance and success of the software support team, making data-driven decisions to drive continuous improvement.
* Provide regular reports and updates to senior management on support team performance, key metrics, and areas for improvement.
* Stay abreast of industry best practices and trends in software support management, implementing relevant changes and improvements as needed.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field is preferred but not required.
* Several years of experience in software support management, preferably within the EMS or healthcare technology industry.
* Proven track record of developing and implementing support processes and systems to enhance team performance and customer satisfaction.
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire team members to achieve excellence.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, team members, and senior management.
* Proficiency in Zendesk, Jira, and other support tools and technologies.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and metrics to drive decision-making and continuous improvement.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality support services to clients.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt quickly to changing priorities and requirements.

**How to Apply:**  
If you are passionate about software support management and possess the skills and experience outlined above, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and why you would be a great fit for this position.

Traumasoft is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity in the workplace. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

Pay: $80,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* support management: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Development Senior Manager (Omni Channel)
description:
**Making a job change is a big decision. Why consider Aptos?**



You will join a team of remarkable colleagues who are committed and passionate about creating and delivering leading-edge solutions to the retail market. You will be part of an exciting growth journey where we will do everything possible to help you reach and exceed your career dreams. Our colleagues have access to industry-leading training and development opportunities, and the chance to work in a global, diverse culture with offices in 13 countries. You will be part of an inclusive culture that is grounded in our Company's purpose: to make a difference for **every colleague, every client, every day.**



With years of deep retail DNA, Aptos has been a market-leading platform that drives the world's largest retailers' product, promotion, commerce and merchandising decisions across online and brick-and-mortar operations. The opportunity at Aptos has never been greater, as we transition our solutions to cloud-native, microservices architecture. More than 135,000 retail locations impact nearly $2 trillion in annual revenue across fashion, grocery, drug, convenience, general merchandise, discount and sporting goods stores optimized with Aptos' solutions. We hope you'll be a part of taking innovative solutions to market with the leader in Unified Commerce.


As the Senior Manager Software Development (Omni Channel), you will play a pivotal role in driving the design and development of new applications, components, and services on our next-generation cloud-native commerce platform. Leveraging modern tools, techniques, and methodologies, you will lead a team in delivering thin slices of end-to-end functionality on a regular cadence. Your passion for mastering emerging technologies and your experience in leading agile teams will be crucial in ensuring the success of our projects.

  

Roles & Responsibilities


* Lead the Omni Channel development team, overseeing the design and delivery of omni solutions.
* Actively participate the Agile/Scrum environments, driving continuous improvement and efficient delivery practices.
* Our current technology stack includes Typescript/JavaScript, polyglot storage solutions and React/ React Native on the client side, expressed as a containerized microservices architecture supporting a suite of Mobile Client Apps.
* You will be working on our newest product offering Aptos ONE; a cloud-native, mobile-first, and unified commerce services platform. This will enable retailers to respond to changing market demands across all customer touchpoints.
* Manage the lifecycle and delivery of projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and timelines.
* Mentor team members, set standards, conduct code reviews, and foster a culture of collaboration and innovation.
  


Qualifications:


* Minimum of 10 + years' experience in Software Development
* Designing and delivering high visibility omni channel solutions
* Proficiency in React, Typescript, Node.js, and microservices architecture
* Strong background in Agile/Scrum methodologies, with experience leading and mentoring teams.
* Any background in retail, high-end transactional systems, eCommerce, point of sale (POS), or with payment, trading or banking solutions would be a big plus
* Experience with React is required, while knowledge of React Native is a significant advantage.
* Any exposure to .Net technologies would be beneficial.


Preferred:


* Previous experience in payment, trading, or banking solutions.
* Understanding of cloud-native architectures and services.


#LI-TM1


We offer a competitive total rewards package including a base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. By submitting an application for this job, you acknowledge that any personal data or personally identifiable information that you provide to us will be processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Product Manager (Recreation)
description:
**Remote opportunity**  

  

At DaySmart Software, we are a dynamic and energetic SaaS company that specializes in providing best-in-class scheduling and business management solutions to companies across the globe.  

  

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a **Product Manager** to support our DaySmart Recreation Software, which services a variety of customers, from NHL teams to indoor sports centers, school districts and municipal parks and rec departments. Our solution helps these businesses and government organizations manage their resources for: leagues, classes, camps, parties, corporate events, and other programming to help promote health and enrich lives.  

  

**As a Product Manager, you will:*** Drive the execution of all processes in the product lifecycle, including product and market research, competitor analysis, planning, positioning, requirements and roadmap development, and product launch
* Develop detailed product scope documents and oversee implementation from ideation to launch through working cross-functionally
* Create product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI
* Translate scopes into detailed requirements for prototyping and final development for design and engineering teams
* Assess current competitor offerings and seek opportunities for differentiation
* Analyze market data to develop go-to-market strategy
* Closely analyze customer needs and gain a deep understanding of customer pain points and areas of improvement
* Comfortable wearing multiple hats to drive progress and balance resources to ensure success
* Exceptional writing and editing skills, combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills

**Required skills:*** At least 2+ years experience of demonstrated Product Management experience in the SaaS industry
* Exceptional organization and communication skills and experience with asynchronous written-first culture combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills
* High effectiveness in managing cross-functional teams
* Based in North America
* Strong experience in a dynamic product management role
* Proven success in overseeing all elements of the product development lifecycle
* High effectiveness in managing cross-functional teams
* Experience in delivering finely tuned product strategy

**Preferred skills:*** Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent)
* Experience with, or eagerness to learn, the problems fitness studio owners, instructors, and customers face
* Previous experience using JIRA, Notion & Figma
* Previous experience in Health, Fitness & Wellness
* Demonstrable knowledge of Agile Software practices

  

DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Client Project Manager - EdTech (remote)
description:
\\*\\* Over 2,000 student lives saved **-** SaaS **- EdTech**



\\*\\* **Student Wellness and AI products Awarded as the EdTech Product of the year three years in a row****.**



\\*\\* Awarded **TOP PLACE TO WORK** 3 years in a row

  




**Summary:**



The Securly Eduspire products Pass and Flex have 2+ million users in 50 states and have **doubled in size for three years in a row!** This is why we need a new Client Project Manager (CPM). This is a critical role for the client support, implementation, and operations team for Eduspire's products within Securly. Eduspire Client Project Managers support the two Eduspire products, Pass and Flex, and may need to support new products in the future. Your days will be spent talking to school administrators and internal staff to implement Eduspire products and respond to school admin's questions. You will report directly to the Director of Client Support.

  



To learn more about the product: https://www.securly.com/pass and https://www.securly.com/flex

  

**This is a remote role but candidates must be able and willing to work Mon to Fri 8 am to 5 pm Pacific or Mountain time zone**

  


**What You Will Do:**



The CPM has 4 main areas of responsibility:



* **New Client Implementations:** Managing new client implementations by serving as the project manager coordinating the client team members, the Eduspire technical team (including offshore developers), and other operational resources as needed.


* **Existing Client Support:** Serving as a client support resource for existing clients, by working to resolve any client support tickets entered in the customer help desks through Zendesk, and coordinating with the client team members, the Eduspire technical team (including offshore developers), and other operational resources as needed.


* **Product Development Support:** Assisting Product Managers with the product development of new and existing Eduspire products by testing new feature functionality, providing user documentation, and providing user feedback as needed.


* **Sales Support:** Supporting the sales process for Eduspire products, primarily by conducting remote software demonstrations online for prospects, answering prospects' questions during the sales process, and otherwise assisting the Eduspire sales team.



The Client Project Manager must utilize their training and skill in service of our clients:


* For the application of systems analysis techniques and procedures, including consulting with users to determine hardware, software or functional requirements;
* For the design, development, documentation, analysis, creation, testing or modification of computer systems or programs, including prototypes, based on and related to user or system design specifications;
* For the design, documentation, testing, creation or modification of computer programs related to machine or user operating requirements; and
* For a combination of the aforementioned duties, the performance of which requires the same level of skills.

  


**Preferred Qualifications, Skills, and Experience:**


* 3+ years of educational or classroom background desired
* 3+ years of experience presenting to audiences
* Comfortable working in a fully remote working environment
* Client-facing and customer service-oriented
* Organized, can multi-task, and be flexible with time
* Strong work ethic and self-managing, capable of working independently
* Detail-oriented and task-focused, good at listening and documenting
* Takes initiative and enjoys challenges
* Comfortable learning new technical systems, some general technical background helpful

  



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  


**About Securly, Inc.**


* Recognized as Top Places to Work 3 years in a row
* Product of the 3 years in a row
* Securly One Page
* 45-second cloud product demo


**Innovation** - Our innovative products and talented people have;


* Established Securly in over 20% of the US market and growing rapidly internationally
* Implemented Securly into 15,000+ schools
* Monitored more than 5+ billion online activities
* Revolutionized student wellness and school safety for more than 10+ million children
* Saved the lives of more than 2000+ children


**Some of the Perks**


* Recognized as Top Places to Work for multiple years in a row
* Robust company-sponsored benefits package
* Unlimited free access to well-being and mental health resources
* Unlimited Vacation (Flex Time)
* Annual $1,000 Employee Professional Development Stipend
* Holiday Break - closed the week between Christmas and New Year
* 401k with employer match

title: Engineering Manager
description:
at Parachute Health
U.S. Remote
In the U.S. alone, over 30 million patients per year are prescribed care via paper and fax. The legacy ordering process is long, complicated, and yields an 83% error rate, resulting in patients ending up in the hospital or worse.



The world is transitioning to Digital Ordering across the healthcare industry. At Parachute Health, we’re leading the charge with a platform that is 10 times faster than the status quo. We connect with major hospitals, payors, and suppliers of life-saving products. Our vision of a "delightfully simple" digital ordering experience for clinicians pushes us forward to transforming the world of post-acute care.



Since launching, we’ve helped millions of patients. Founded in New York City, we’ve grown across 50 states and partnered with 50,000 clinical facilities and over 2,000 supplier locations across 20,000+ products on the Parachute Platform.


### **Responsibilities:**


* Develop in an agile environment, including TDD and flexible pair programming.
* Contribute to balanced teams, working with product and design to shape the application.
* Coach up to 5 engineers in career growth and improvement
* Guide the engineering practice across teams to create more effective methods
* Hybrid IC/manager position with at least 50% hands-on coding
* Participate in an on-call rotation, ensuring timely resolution of critical system issues, and contributing to the continuous improvement of our system reliability and availability

  


### **Requirements:**


* Minimum of 5 years of experience delivering software in a production environment
* Minimum of 2 year of management experience
* Professional Ruby on Rails or React experience
* Must reside in the U.S.

  


### **Nice to have:**


* Delight in learning
* Experience in designing goal-driven interviewing and hiring processes
* Experience working cross-functionally to improve business process
* Experience as technical lead on projects working with UX/UI design and/or product management.

  


### **Benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Remote-First Company with the option to work at our offices located in Denver and New York City
* Equity Incentive Plan
* Annual Company-Wide Bonus (up to 15%)
* Flexible Vacation Policy
* Summer Fridays - 5 Fridays Off During Summer (Separate From PTO)
* Monthly Internet Stipend
* Annual Home Office Stipend
* Co-Working Space Reimbursement
* Annual stipend for education and development

  


### **Base Salary:**



$175 -235K
